clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Supraglottic and Oropharyngeal Decontamination on the Incidence of Ventilator-associated Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Supraglottic and Oropharyngeal Decontamination on the Incidence of Ventilator-associated Pneumonia and Associated Microbiomes.

brief_summary.textblock: Oropharynx is the main source of pathogen microorganisms for the ventilator - associated pneumoniae. As known bacteriophages can eliminate different pathogen microorganisms or reduce a degree of a pathogen's colonization. The research team is considering that oropharyngeal decontamination with bacteriophages can prevent the developing of the ventilator - associated pneumoniae. There will be three groups in this investigation: placebo, antiseptic drug (Octenisept) and bacteriophage (Sexthaphag).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline CPIS at 14 days
primary_outcome.description: CPIS is using for diagnosis the VAP, if CPIS equal or more 6, the VAP will be confirmed

primary_outcome.measure: Changing of oral and lung microbiomes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Microbiology researching at 14 days
primary_outcome.description: Microbiology researching samples from oral cavity and trachea. The Gram positive and Gram negative aerobes and anaerobes will be assessed with observing Colony Form Unit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Sequential Organ Function Assessment at 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Sequential Organ Function Assessment (SOFA) will be using for assessment organ dysfunction Patient examination with Sequential Organ Function Assessment (SOFA). If Sequential Organ Function Assessment more then 2 points Organ dysfunction is present. The hirher value is equal worse outcome

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline CRP at 14 days
Change from Baseline PCT at 14 days
Change from Baseline PCT at 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality for 28 days of a hospitalization

intervention.description: Oropharyngeal decontamination with saline will be performing three time a day every 8 hours during mechanical ventilation
Oropharyngeal decontamination with antiseptic solution will be performing three time a day every 8 hours during mechanical ventilation
Oropharyngeal decontamination with bacteriophage will be performing three time a day every 8 hours during mechanical ventilation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- invasive mechanical ventilation beyond 48 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- hospital - acquired pneumonia
- community - acquired pneumoniae
- BMI > 35 kg/cm2
- pregnancy
- tracheostomy
- reintubation
